intro: Physaria gordonii var. densifolia, commonly known as the denseleaf bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are dense and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in arid environments. The species is also noted for its ability to self-pollinate, which aids in its reproductive success in less hospitable conditions.
